cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 mi SSW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to accelerate north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, make landfall in Florida’s Big Bend, then sweep across southeast Georgia and emerge just offshore of the South Carolina coast before moving northeastward along/just off the NC Outer Banks

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sebastian Inlet, FL northward to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Storm-Surge warnings confined to Florida Gulf coast (none yet for GA/SC)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, southeast Georgia, and the South Carolina coast including Charleston, then up to coastal North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible late Wed into Thu; 44 % peak 34-kt onset probability and 27 % 50-kt cumulative probability at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Watch in effect; 2–4 ft of inundation possible from the mouth of the St. Mary’s River to South Santee River, including Charleston Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Wed–Thu with locally higher amounts, bringing a risk of flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous rip currents/surf possible as the system passes.
